intro: Deguelia brachyptera, commonly known as the broad-leaved deguelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, butterfly-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Deguelia brachyptera is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
